text: In this video, I'll show you how to create
a group on Roblox.
Creating a group costs 100 Robux,

so you'll need to make
sure you have enough Robux
in your balance.

If you don't, click on the
Robux icon on the website
and select "Buy Robux."

Select the amount of
Robux you want to buy.
Since I only needed 100 Robux,

I bought the cheapest
option, which was 400 Robux.
Now click on the groups tab
here in the sidebar of the Roblox website.
Then, underneath the list of groups,
click on "Create Group."
If you haven't joined a Roblox group yet,
you may see this page.

Just click on the "Create
Group" button over here.
Enter a name for your group
as well as a brief description.
At the time of recording,

you're unable to change
the name of your group
once it's created,

so make sure you're happy
with your group's name.
Now add an image for your group's emblem.

This image will appear on
the group page as the icon.
Next, you need to decide whether you want

any Roblox user to be
able to join your group
or only specific users who you can choose.
For example, if you only want your friends
to be a part of your group,
you'd choose manual approval.

With manual approval, any
users who join the group
are pending until you accept them
through the group admin panel.

With anyone can join, any
user can join the group.

Now, click on the green
button to purchase your group.
And click on "Purchase."

If there is a group
already using your name,

you'll be asked to change the
name before you can proceed.

If this is the case,
simply decide on a new name
and click the buy button again.
If you selected manual approval,
then to accept pending users,

you'll need to go to the
group configuration panel.

To do this, click on the
three dots on your group page
and select "Configure Group."

In this panel, we can
configure aspects of our group,
such as the emblem and description.

We can also accept new
members into the group
if they're pending.

Click on the members
tab on the left sidebar,
then select "Requests."
Here you can accept all, decline all,

or individually accept or
decline members into your group.
